description.p: Field Types are definitions governing the structure and behavior of fields in Symphony. They determine how fields are rendered in the admin interface, what types of data a field can accept, how that data is captured and stored, and how it is formatted and output for use on the front end. Symphony has eight core field types; additional field types are available as extensions.
Field types determine the structure of a field’s settings pane when it is added to a section in the section editor.
The are eight core field types in Symphony, and a ninth, Select Box Link, is provided by a default extension.
The author field type is represented by a select input populated with system authors. Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: Checkbox specifying whether to allow the selection of multiple authors.
Checkbox specifying whether the author editing the entry should be selected by default.

description.p: The checkbox field type is represented by a basic checkbox input. Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: Text to be displayed alongside the checkbox in lieu of a label.
Checkbox specifying whether the field should default to checked.

description.p: The date field type is represented by a basic text input. The format expected by the field is determined by the configuration settings created during installation and found in /manifest.config.php. Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: Checkbox specifying whether the current date should be auto-entered into the field upon entry creation.

description.p: The file upload field type is represented by a file input. Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: Where files uploaded with this field will be stored. Select input populated by a list of all the directories under workspace/. Directory must be writeable.
Regular expressions pattern used to validate the file name.

description.p: The select box field type is represented by a select input that can be populated with static values, dynamic values, or both. Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: A comma-delimited list of values to include in the field’s options.
List of fields, organized by section, whose content can be used to populate this field’s options.
Checkbox specifying whether or not to allow multiple items to be selected.

description.p: The Select Box Link field type is represented by a select input that is populated by entries in a linked section and creates a persistent relationship with the linked entry(ies). Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: List of fields, organized by section, whose content can be used to populate this field’s options.
How many of the most recent entries to show as options.
Checkbox specifying whether or not to allow multiple items to be selected.

description.p: The tag list field type is represented by a text input that accepts a comma-delimited list of values. It is followed by a dynamically-populated suggestion list. Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: Source of suggested items. Can be content from another field in the system, or values from this field from other entries in the section.
Regular expressions pattern used to validate the items.

description.p: The textarea field type is represented by a textarea input that can apply text formatters to its content. Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: Height of the textarea in rows.
Text formatter to be applied to the field’s content.

description.p: The text input field type is represented by a basic text input. Its settings pane provides the following options:

tr.td: Regular expressions pattern used to validate the input.

summary.p: Field Types define the structure of fields and govern their behavior in capturing and outputting data.
